title: Parts of Morrissey Blvd. may close this week due to high tide flooding
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Morrissey Boulevard may see closures from Tuesday to Sunday due to high tide flooding, impacting sections near UMass Boston.
Mass. Department of Conservation & Recreation warns tidal heights could reach up to 12 feet, triggering potential midday closures.
Traffic patterns will be marked, and DCR staff will manage operations, with potential closure of the I-93 off ramp.

title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Polls in Boston open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. at 275 precincts for the Tuesday election.
Mayor Michelle Wu is running unopposed, but all Boston City Council at-large seats have contested races.
Ballots are available in multiple languages and mail-in voters can track status on the state's website.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins' second line, featuring Pavel Zacha, Casey Mittelstadt, and Viktor Arvidsson, is proving effective offensively.
Since Mittelstadt's return, the Bruins' second line outscored opponents 4-2, with Mittelstadt posting six points in seven games.
Coach Marco Sturm praises Mittelstadt's performance after being benched, contributing to four wins in the last five games.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalists for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet named finalist for AL Cy Young Award after leading AL in innings pitched (205.1) and strikeouts (255).
Crochet's season included an 18-5 record, 2.59 ERA, and strong playoff performance, securing a win against the Yankees.
Roman Anthony, playing only 71 games, finalist for AL Rookie of the Year with .292 average, 8 home runs, 32 RBIs.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots seek to bolster their roster before the NFL trade deadline due to current thin positional depth.
Edge rusher is a top priority for the Patriots, aiming to improve their pass rush consistency and sack numbers.
Running back depth is a concern for the Patriots due to existing player injuries, prompting potential trade pursuits.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots allowed 34 sacks this season, second-most in NFL, with 12 in the last two games.
Patriots' offensive line struggles, with rookies and new starters contributing to high sack numbers for Drake Maye.
Drake Maye matches last season's sack total in fewer games; line grades vary from 74.2 to 53.6 by PFF rankings.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The Liberty Hotel in Boston settled a discrimination complaint after a woman was wrongly accused of being a man.
The hotel agreed to a $10,000 donation and staff anti-discrimination training as part of the settlement.
Following the settlement, the couple plans to file a civil lawsuit seeking punitive damages against the hotel.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris retracted accusations of Patriots simulating Atlanta's snap count during a 24-23 loss.
Morris initially claimed the Patriots mimicked QB Michael Penix Jr.'s clapping, leading to an early snap and penalty.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismissed 'clapgate' claims, citing no observed simulation of offensive signals.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, seeking free agency with aspirations for a longer deal.
Bregman, 32, had two years and $80 million left on his Red Sox contract, signed in February.
Red Sox face competition from teams like the Tigers and Mariners for Bregman, a veteran leader and strong defender.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots face trade decisions ahead of 4 p.m. Tuesday NFL deadline with possible roster upgrades.
Patriots are exploring options for an edge rusher, with Dre'Mont Jones off to Ravens and Cowboys pursuing Trey Hendrickson.
Linebacker Anfernee Jennings may be traded as the Patriots discuss possible moves for roster enhancements.
